sense.name: focus on, center upon
sense.examples: Her entire attention was concentrated on her children. Please concentrate on your studies and not your hobbies. So I concentrated on the rhythmic side of things, and therefore left a lot of holes. You've got to concentrate bigtime. His reflexes were slowing as he tried to concentrate on the game.

sense.name: cluster or gather together, as by condensing all elements
sense.examples: Because their electrons aren't as tightly concentrated, the resulting attraction is too weak. In the district of Krosno the occupiers concentrated the Jew population in the ghettos.

sense.name: make purer, more intense, as by removal of extraneous elements
sense.examples: The cook concentrated the sauce by boiling if for a long time. A series of five emptied bladders concentrated the bile coming to them. I concentrated the sample to dryness, then dissolved in ethyl acetate.
